author: R Vimal Kumar
text: BJP Sate president, Tamilisai Sounderrajan, on Tuesday said that the BJP has been looking for alliance not because the party was weak. “The need of the hour is to fulfil the desire of the people to have a change from the successive governance of AIADMK and DMK. To achieve this, we looked for alliance to reduce the split of votes,” she told The Hindu. She was here to attend a school function. She said that it was not the duty of BJP alone to form an alliance. Other parties too should see that the people of the State needed a political change which could create a difference in infrastructure, irrigation and health sectors. The election officials need to be more alert in curbing the distribution of gifts and tokens to buy liquor.
title: Aim is to defeat AIADMK, DMK, says BJP
